question.body: Many people with coronary atherosclerosis do not have any signs of this disorder at rest, but develop them during exertion. This is because __________.

multiple_choice.choice: the coronary arteries can’t dilate when the local myocytes tell them to
at rest, the cells of the heart are receiving too much blood, so signs only developed when this changes
the plaque gets larger during exertion, limiting flow
there are less anastomoses available during exertion

response.feedback: Correct. The plaque prevents the coronary arteries from dilating so that they cannot deliver as much blood (and therefore oxygen) to the downstream myocytes.
Incorrect. At rest, the heart cells are not receiving too much blood, they get just enough. But signs do develop when the activity level of the cells increases and supply cannot meet this demand.
Incorrect. Plaques grow slowly and do not acutely change size.
Incorrect. There are few anastomoses in the heart at any time and it doesn’t change with exertion.
